page.title: 01South east Derby
page.content: This area embraces a mixture of residential, industrial and farming land on the edge of the city of Derby. The industrial is dominated by Rolls Royce, the aero-engine makers.They are the main employers in the area. Other employers include a bakery and a swimwear factory. Housing varies from Victorian villas through interwar "semis"and postwar council estates(including "prefab" bungalows well past their original design life) to modern low-energy houses on estates still being built. Beyond the houses and factories land is still farmed within the city boundary - mainly as grazing land but with a few arable fields. Large tracts of land on the edge of the built up area are occupied by schools and their playing fields.
